meanings.definition: To fight against or struggle with
meanings.sent1: The brave knight combated the fierce dragon to protect the village.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers combated the enemy forces in a fierce battle.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel combated the stubborn nut to finally crack it open.
meanings.sent4: The determined student combated the difficult math problem until she solved it.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter combated the raging flames to save the trapped family.

meanings.sent1: The community combated the construction of the noisy factory near their homes.
meanings.sent2: The protestors combated the unjust laws with peaceful demonstrations.
meanings.sent3: The cat combated the idea of taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The superhero combated the villain's evil plans to protect the city.
meanings.sent5: The student combated the temptation to procrastinate and focused on studying instead.

meanings.definition: To engage in battle or conflict
meanings.sent1: The two rival gangs combated for control of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The ancient warriors combated on the battlefield with swords and shields.
meanings.sent3: The siblings combated over who gets to choose the TV show to watch.
meanings.sent4: The football teams combated fiercely for the championship title.
meanings.sent5: The nations combated in a diplomatic war of words to avoid actual conflict.
